Varieties of Stones www.ephenry.com/walkways.aspx

Stones are either rough or finished. A rough stone is any stone that hasn't been altered. But finishing stones are perfectly shaped to be used as brick.

Varieties of Stone Walls

Stone walls come in a couple of types, dry and mortar wall. The dry stone walls usually rely upon the force of friction between its stones to stand still. These stones are laid in overlapping manners over one another to form a loose but stable wall. Mortared walls fill in the gaps between the stones with cement, basically turning the wall into one solid unit.

Building a Dry Stone Wall

Other than the heavy lifting, a dry stone wall is easy to build. First off dig the trench to place the wall inside. It should be slightly wider than the wall. Then gravel is filled in the trench to make the foundation. While using rough stone place larger one to cover the gravel and then use smaller ones to fill the gap. This process is repeated to help make various layers. Make sure that gaps are filled properly in order to make stable walls indeed. When you use finishing stones the process becomes more convenient. Finishing stones are more expensive and don’t have the typical rustic look of rough stones.
